title: Syllabus mentioned in ERP
text: Prerequisite: NilGeneral Introduction, Electrified Interfaces: Electric double layer; Helmholtz and Gouy-Chapman models; double-layer capacitance; specific and non-specific adsorption; Debye-HÃ¼ckel theory. Mass Transfer: Modes of mass transfer; electrolyte conductance; the role of the supporting electrolyte; iR drop and strategies for minimizing it; membrane liquid junction potentials; the diffusion coefficient; Fick s Laws of diffusion; concentration-distance profiles; Electron Transfer Kinetics: Standard rate constant; transfer coefficient; Tafel equation; Marcus theory; Butler-Volmer equation; Tafel plots. Books: Modern Electrochemistry 2A: Fundamentals of electrodics, J. OM. Bockeris, A.K.N. Reddy and M.G-Aldeco; Kluwer academic, 2001; Electrochemical methods: Fundamentals and Applications, A. J. Bard and L.R. Faulkner, Wiley, 2000.
